Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
Sidney and Clara Solomon Papers TAM 454
0.5 Linear Feet 1 manuscript box
1920s-1940s This collection contains the papers of Sidney and Clara Solomon. Sidney and Clara Solomon were both New York anarchists and were members of the Vanguard Group in the 1930s and the New Trends Group in the 1940s. This collection most notably contains many letters from Emma Goldman and some other correspondence from John Dewey. The collection also contains some materials, including minutes, from the Vanguard Group and some flyers pertaining to leftist causes like Spanish labor and relief in the 1930s. The materials span from the 1920s to the 1940s. Materials are in English 1
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restrictions.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Materials found in collection; provenance is unknown. The accession numbers associated with this collection are 1996.004 and 2006.061.
Arrangement
Materials in this collection have not been arranged by an archivist.
Historical/Biographical Note
Sidney and Clara Solomon were both New York anarchists and were members of the Vanguard Group in the 1930s and the New Trends Group in the 1940s. The Vanguard Group was a New York anarcho-communist group, which published a magazine called Vanguard and dissipated during World War II.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date; Sidney and Clara Solomon Papers; TAM 454; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Processing Information
Minutes from several 1939 Vanguard Group meetings were separated from this collection during initial processing and were established as a separate collection, the Vanguard Group Minutes (TAM 389). In 2015, the Vanguard collection was reincorporated into the Sidney and Clara Slomon Papers.
Scope and Contents
This collection most notably contains many letters from Emma Goldman and some other correspondence from John Dewey. The collection also contains some materials, including minutes, from the Vanguard Group and some flyers pertaining to leftist causes like Spanish labor and relief in the 1930s. The materials span from the 1920s to the 1940s.
Conditions Governing Use
Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive has no information about copyright ownership for this collection and is not authorized to grant permission to publish or reproduce materials from it. Materials in this collection, which were created in the 1920s-1940s, are expected to enter the public domain in 2060.
